description: Stores data for College of American Pathologists (CAP) form 76019-EWING SARCOMA/PRIMITIVE NEUROECTODERMAL TUMOR: Resection.

columns.name: RESULT_ID
columns.description: The unique identifier for the result record.

columns.name: TUMOR_SITE_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify tumor site.

columns.name: CAP_COMMENTS
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: General comments.

columns.name: SPEC_PROC_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify the Specimen Procedure.

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_GREAT
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Greatest Size.

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_ADDL
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Size (length).

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_ADDL2
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Tumor Size (width).

columns.name: TUMOR_SIZE_SPECIFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Tumor Size.

columns.name: SPEC_PROC_AMPU_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specimen Procedure Amputation Specify.

columns.name: EXT_OSSEOS_TMR_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Extent of Osseous Tumors.

columns.name: EXTRAOSS_TMR_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify Extent of Primary Extraosseous Tumors.

columns.name: SPECIFIC_MARGINS
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specific Margins.

columns.name: DIST_CLSEST_BNE_MRG
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Distance of Tumor from Closest Bone Margin.

columns.name: DIST_CLSEST_SFT_TIS
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Distance of Tumor from Closest Soft Tissue Margin.

columns.name: NECROSIS_POSTCHEM_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Necrosis Postchemotherapy.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Necrosis not identified


Necrosis present


Cannot be determined


Not applicable

columns.name: NECROSIS_EXTENT
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Necrosis Extent.

columns.name: CYTOGENETICS_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Cytogenetics.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Specify


Performed, see separate report


Performed


Not performed

columns.name: CYTOGENETICS_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify cytogenetics.

columns.name: MOLECULAR_PATH_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Molecular Pathology.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: CYTOGENETICS_C_NAME

columns.name: MOLECULAR_PATH_SPFY
columns.description: CAP synoptic form item: Specify molecular pathology.

columns.name: STG_OSS_EXTRA_TMR_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Stage for Osseous and Extraosseous Tumors.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


For Primary Osseous Tumors (Note G)


For Primary Extraosseous Tumors (Note H)

columns.name: PT_PRM_EXTRAOS_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Primary Tumor (pT) for Primary Extraosseous Tumors.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed


pT0: No evidence of primary tumor


pT1a: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension, superficial tumor


pT1b: Tumor 5 cm or less in greatest dimension, deep tumor


pT2a: Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension, superficial tumor


pT2b: Tumor more than 5 cm in greatest dimension, deep tumor

columns.name: PT_PRM_OSSEOUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Primary Tumor (pT) for Primary Osseous Tumors.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed


pT0: No evidence of primary tumor


pT1: Tumor 8 cm or less in greatest dimension


pT2: Tumor more than 8 cm in greatest dimension


pT3: Discontinuous tumors in the primary bone site (not including skip metastases)

columns.name: PM_PRM_EXTRAOS_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Distant Metastasis (pM) for Primary Extraosseous Tumors.


May contain organization-specific values: Yes


 Category Entries: 


Not applicable


cM0 (i+): No clinical or radiographic evidence of distant metastasis


pM0: No distant metastasis


pM1: Distant metastasis


pM1a: Intraperitoneal metastasis beyond the right lower quadrant, including pseudomyx


pM1b: Nonperitoneal metastasis


pM1: Distant detectable metastasis as determined by classic clinical


pM1 (IVB): Distant metastasis


pM1a: Separate tumor nodule(s) in contralateral lung; tumor with pleural nodules or


pM1b: Distant metastases outside the lung / pleura


pM1: Distant metastasis (documented in this specimen)


pM1a: Metastasis in skin, subcutaneous tissues, or distant lymph nodes


pM1b: Metastasis to lung


pM1c: Metastasis to all other visceral sites or distant metastasis at any site


pM1a: Nonregional lymph node(s)


pM1b: Bone(s)


pM1c: Other site(s) with or without bone disease


pM1: Metastasis to sites other than CNS


pM1a: Single lesion


pM1b: Multiple lesions


pM1c: CNS metastasis


pM1d: Discrete mass(es) without leptomeningeal and / or CSF involvement


pM1e: Leptomeningeal and / or CSF involvement


pM1a: Non-regional lymph nodes or pulmonary metastasis


pM1b: Distant metastasis other than to nonregional lymph nodes and lungs


pM1a (III): Tumor extends to the lungs with or without genital tract involvement


pM1b (IV): Tumor involves other metastatic sites


pM1a: Largest diameter of the largest metastasis 3 cm or less


pM1b: Largest diameter of the largest metastasis 3.1-8.0 cm


pM1c: Largest diameter of the largest metastasis 8 cm or more


pM1a: Lung


pM1b: Metastasis involving distant sites other than lung (including skip metastases)


Distant Metastasis present (includes metastasis to lymph nodes)

columns.name: PM_PRM_OSSEOUS_C_NAME
columns.description:
CAP synoptic form item: Distant Metastasis (pM) for Primary Osseous Tumors.


 The category values for this column were already listed for column: PM_PRM_EXTRAOS_C_NAME

pN1b: Metastases to unilateral, bilateral or contralateral cervical

pN1: Regional lymph node involvement (preauricular, cervical, submandibular)

pN2: Metastasis in 4 or more regional lymph nodes


pN2: Metastasis to periaortic/pericaval/super. mesentery artery/celiac artery lym nd

pN2b: Metastasis in 7 or more regional lymph nodes


pN2 (IIIC2): Regional lymph node metastasis to para-aortic lymph nodes, with or witho


pN2: 3 to 6 nodes involved


pN2: Metastases to periaortic,pericaval,super. mesenteric artery, celiac artery lym n

pN2a: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, more than 3 cm but not more than


pN2b: Metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph nodes, none >6cm in greatest dimension


pN2b: Metastasis in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none >6cm in greatest dimension

pN2: Metastases in the subcarinal or the ipsilateral mediastinal lymph nodes

pN2b: Clinically apparent (macroscopic) metastasis


pN2c: Satellite or in-transit metastasis without nodal metastasis

pN2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm

pN3: Metastasis in perirectal and inguinal lymph nodes and / or bilateral internal il


pN3: 7 or more nodes involved


pN3: Metastasis in a lymph node more than 6 cm in greatest dimension


pN3: Metastasis in contralateral mediastinal, contralateral hilar, ipsilateral or
